content: In Greek mythology, who was the god of wine and celebration, often associated with theater and art?

In Greek mythology, the god of wine, celebration, theater, and art is Dionysus. He is one of the twelve Olympian deities and is known for bringing joy and ecstasy through wine and theatrical performances. Dionysus is also associated with fertility, ritual madness, and religious ecstasy. His festivals were famous for their revelry and were central to Greek religious life.
